intro: Cnemidostachys glabrata, commonly known as the slender spike grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typically green or pale in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or disturbed sites. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as a ornamental or for erosion control.
